18564395e01dfb000d27daf9a939784b (02:16): well samuel .. either slug through the !y2pmsh yast configs mate.  or me favorite lazy fast fix path here is !smart
d5ac8f15019ca6d5c5eab34ce1b5712d (02:17): !smart

2df02513b1d88e78542a6a8a65beb11a (02:17): smart is a package management frontend that supports many repository formats - The Guru build comes preloaded with Inst-Source, Non-OSS, Packman, Guru, and KDE supp repositories. Here is a spoon-fed howto: http://susewiki.org/index.php?title=SMART_Package_Manager - smart home page: http://smartpm.org
d5ac8f15019ca6d5c5eab34ce1b5712d (02:17): !yum
2df02513b1d88e78542a6a8a65beb11a (02:17): Rumour has it yum is a yellow dog installer
18564395e01dfb000d27daf9a939784b (02:17): !helpme @ samuel get to know here mate.  she saves us and you time ;]]

2df02513b1d88e78542a6a8a65beb11a (02:17): samuel: To get help from me you can ask for keywords (factoids) in pvt with /msg SuSEhelp <factoid_name> . To search the keywords try /msg SuSEhelp search <string_to_search> (or check at http://susewiki.apanela.com/bot_help)
d5ac8f15019ca6d5c5eab34ce1b5712d (02:17): samuel: smart uses whatever repositories you have available
d5ac8f15019ca6d5c5eab34ce1b5712d (02:18): samuel: it's a 'meta' package manager if you're familiar with the concept
